paragraphs.text: Journal of Popular Film and Television is a quarterly peer-reviewed academic journal published by Routledge, which purchased it from Heldref Publications in 2009.[1][2] Michael Marsden, who was the dean of the College of Arts & Sciences at Northern Michigan University in the late 1990s, co-founded the journal.[3] The journal was established in 1971, with the first issue in 1972 and until 1978 was titled Journal of Popular Film.[4] The journal is devoted to publishing criticism that "examines commercial film and television from a sociocultural perspective."[5]

paragraphs.title: Abstracting and indexing
paragraphs.text: The journal is abstracted and indexed by Current Contents/Arts & Humanities, EBSCOhost, MLA International Bibliography, Scopus, and the Arts & Humanities Citation Index.
